title: Understanding Codependency
text: Codependency is a behavioral condition where one person enables another person's addiction, poor mental health, immaturity, irresponsibility, or under-achievement.

title: Recognizing Enabling Behavior
text: Enabling behavior often involves making excuses for the addicted person, covering up their mistakes, or taking on their responsibilities.

hintAnswer: enabling the addicted person to continue their $$self-destructive$$ behavior
title: Identifying Codependent Actions
text: Which of the following actions is an example of codependency?
choices: enabling the addicted person to continue their $$self-destructive$$ behavior
helping the addicted person through withdrawal
helping the addicted person to get rid of their $$self-destructive$$ behavior
